intro: Borzicactus gracilis var. camanaensis, commonly known as the Camanaensis Borzicactus, is a cacti species native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it well-suited for xerophytic gardens. Its unique morphology and adaptability to harsh environments make it a notable species in the Cactaceae family.
